oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mess card of Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This is the partial mess card of Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy, Btry F, 318th FA, 81st Div. His mess card as been punched indicating the meals he had eaten. Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy was a farmer from Chapel Hill, Tennessee, when he enlisted in 1917. He was overseas in France from August 8, 1918 until June 11, 1919. Dowdy was promoted to corporal in February 1918 and to sergeant in October 1918.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
